entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-03760
entry.itemBody: In an equally weighted portfolio, the diversification ratio is best described as a measure of the:

answerFeedback.80f01113-366a-4972-b548-8c31015d4af1: Correct because the level of risk reduction from the portfolio approach to investing, relative to the risk of investing in a single security, can be measured by the diversification ratio. A simple measure of the value of diversification is calculated as the ratio of the standard deviation of the equally weighted portfolio to the standard deviation of the randomly selected security. This ratio may be referred to as the diversification ratio. The diversification ratio of the portfolio's standard deviation to the individual asset's standard deviation measures the risk reduction benefits of a simple portfolio construction method, equal weighting.
answerFeedback.e1424e8d-23c6-447e-a1cd-8d950197e77e: Incorrect because the diversification ratio compares the risk of an overall portfolio relative to a single security; it does not measure the amount of risk an asset contributes to the portfolio's risk.
answerFeedback.efd02a2c-9c30-4b05-ba56-99da5abe8889: Incorrect because the diversification ratio compares volatility between a portfolio and a single asset, not between two single assets. A simple measure of the value of diversification is calculated as the ratio of the standard deviation of the equally weighted portfolio to the standard deviation of the randomly selected security.

choices.itemBody: A. relative level of risk between any two individual assets.
B. amount of risk an asset contributes to the portfolio's risk.
C. risk reduction benefit of investing in the portfolio versus a security from the portfolio.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606084
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is most likely part of the feedback step in the portfolio management process?

answerFeedback.44b1a89d-bad2-490f-a37d-2f6bd904fb78: Incorrect because developing the investment policy statement is part of the planning step.
answerFeedback.e053a2e4-bbbf-4fe9-a6c8-b335ec7669b5: Incorrect because portfolio construction is part of the execution step.
answerFeedback.e193ee5f-e872-4ebb-8821-eb331c3f6278: Correct because performance measurement, along with portfolio monitoring and rebalancing, is part of the feedback step.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Chua-09
entry.itemBody: The diversification ratio of a portfolio is best described as the ratio of the:

answerFeedback.1401624a-8902-44c5-b08e-c6a8faaa7cb9: Correct because a simple measure of the value of diversification is calculated as the ratio of the standard deviation of the equally weighted portfolio to the standard deviation of the randomly selected security. This ratio may be referred to as the diversification ratio. In the example of the 5-stock portfolio given, the equally weighted portfolio’s standard deviation is approximately 71 percent of the average standard deviation of the 5 stocks (24.9%); i.e., the denominator is the average standard deviation of all individual securities in the portfolio and the numerator is the standard deviation of the equally weighted portfolio.
answerFeedback.7f9ab3c2-2a69-46ae-8bcf-28409b7487b7: Incorrect because the standard deviation of the equally weighted portfolio should be the numerator (not the denominator) and the denominator should be the average standard deviation of all individual securities in the portfolio.
answerFeedback.bf683164-8a14-4422-af4a-e55ff52b9a20: Incorrect because the average standard deviation of all individual securities in the portfolio should be the denominator (not the numerator) and the numerator should be the standard deviation of the equally weighted portfolio.

choices.itemBody: A. standard deviation of the equally weighted portfolio's returns to the average standard deviation of the individual securities' returns.
B. standard deviation of the market-capitalization-weighted portfolio's returns to the standard deviation of the equally weighted portfolio's returns.
C. average standard deviation of the individual securities' returns to the standard deviation of the market-capitalization-weighted portfolio's returns.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-08462
entry.itemBody: The portfolio approach to investing most likely:

answerFeedback.20cd52f2-f481-4aa7-8eee-de278e6388f9: Incorrect because an asset's risk should be measured in relation to the remaining systematic or non-diversifiable risk, which should be the only risk that affects the asset's price. Systematic risk is risk that cannot be avoided and is inherent in the overall market. It is non-diversifiable because it includes risk factors that are innate within the market and affect the market as a whole. Therefore, portfolio diversification does not reduce the systematic risk of individual assets in a portfolio.
answerFeedback.5f749cff-c1fc-4722-9dcf-efa0ea59f5cb: Incorrect because, although the portfolio approach helps avoid disasters by way of diversification, it does not necessarily provide downside protection (prevent losses) during market downturns. A major reason that portfolios can effectively reduce risk is that combining securities whose returns do not move together provides diversification.  However, an important issue is that the co-movement or correlation pattern of the securities' returns in the portfolio can change in a manner unfavorable to the investor. Despite diversification, a portfolio is unlikely to preserve its value during market downturns.
answerFeedback.70196407-7dcf-4cf5-b6f1-a4472e501b88: Correct because portfolio diversification helps investors avoid disastrous investment outcomes. A main tenet of the portfolio approach to investing is diversification. A disastrous outcome can result from ‘putting all your eggs into one basket' or investing everything into one stock whose value could then go to zero. A diversified portfolio holding many securities is likely to avoid this outcome. Although diversification may not prevent losses during market downturns, it does help avoid disastrous investment outcomes during normal market conditions.

choices.itemBody: A. prevents portfolio losses during market downturns.
B. reduces the systematic risk of individual assets in a portfolio.
C. helps avoid disastrous investment outcomes during normal market conditions.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Tomter-02
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements about pension plans is most accurate?

answerFeedback.2487c219-7751-4388-8fc7-ebaf36c024dd: Incorrect because the risk tolerance for defined benefit pension plans will vary with the maturity of the plan, but is typically quite high.
answerFeedback.39f1d191-3089-4107-97dc-b0bb2e805c7e: Correct because defined benefit pension plans (DB plans) are company-sponsored plans that offer employees a predefined benefit on retirement. The future benefit is defined because the DB plan requires the plan sponsor to specify the obligation stated in terms of the retirement income benefits owed to participants.
answerFeedback.af634905-4ddc-4f68-ad7f-0098e93cbed9: Incorrect because defined contribution pension plans are managed for individual investors, therefore the risk tolerance of each plan varies with the individual. Some individuals will be investing for growth and will therefore seek assets that have the potential for capital gains. Others, such as retirees, may need to draw an income from their assets and may therefore choose to invest more in fixed-income and dividend-paying shares. The investment needs of individuals will depend in part on their broader financial circumstances, such as their employment prospects and whether or not they own their own residence. They may also need to consider such issues as building up a cash reserve and the purchase of appropriate insurance policies before undertaking longer-term investments. The risk tolerance of an individual investor varies by individual.

choices.itemBody: A. Defined benefit plans typically have a low risk tolerance.
B. Defined contribution plans typically have a low risk tolerance.
C. The sponsor of a defined benefit plan specifies the obligation owed to participants.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Tomter-05
entry.itemBody: Open-end mutual funds typically:

answerFeedback.09ceeba3-d75c-4830-91dd-65ecf3d7511d: Correct because the minimum required investment in ETFs is usually smaller than that of mutual funds.
answerFeedback.6c3b87e9-e94a-450f-9a68-0c7fd12a92ca: Incorrect because closed-end, not open-end, mutual funds have a fixed number of shares outstanding. An alternative to setting the fund up as an open-end fund would be to create a closed-end fund in which no new investment money is accepted into the fund. New investors invest by buying existing shares, and investors in the fund liquidate by selling their shares to other investors. Hence, the number of outstanding shares does not change. One consequence of this fixed share base is that, unlike open-end funds in which new shares are created and sold at the current net asset value per share, closed-end funds can sell for a premium or discount to net asset value depending on the demand for the shares.
answerFeedback.a2056051-0d10-4942-bf7c-d550668ef60f: Incorrect because it is an ETF that is priced intraday, not a mutual fund. The value of a mutual fund is referred to as the 'net asset value'. It is computed daily based on the closing price of the securities in the portfolio. Because they are traded on exchanges, ETFs can be transacted (and are priced) intraday. In contrast, mutual funds typically can be purchased or sold only once a day.

choices.itemBody: B. have a fixed number of shares outstanding.
C. have a larger required minimum investment than ETFs.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Niininen-01
entry.itemBody: Robo-advisers most likely:

answerFeedback.769814d2-6c3b-4e49-a568-e539d74a38a6: Incorrect because robo-advisers often rely on lower fee underlying portfolio investment options, such as index funds or ETFs, when constructing portfolios for clients.
answerFeedback.7f8cbb50-2263-4205-af66-f33e79b3539c: Correct because rapid growth in robo-advisory assets is based on several industry trends including growing demand from 'mass affluent' and younger investors. Traditional investment advice has often underserved younger and 'mass affluent' investors with lower relative levels of investable assets.
answerFeedback.d121bdee-1f1b-4e26-ae30-29c8bc49cb8d: Incorrect because reflecting low barriers to entry, large wealth management firms have introduced robo-adviser solutions to service certain customer segments and appeal to a new generation of investors.

choices.itemBody: B. cater to the demand from investors with lower levels of investable assets.
C. prefer actively managed funds to index funds when constructing client portfolios.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Conover-03
entry.itemBody: In regard to the asset allocation process, a top-down analysis most likely begins with an examination of:

answerFeedback.26badaa1-cf44-436e-ab1a-9159a5735940: Incorrect because a top-down analysis begins with consideration of macroeconomic conditions. Bottom-up analysis focuses on company specifics. Rather than emphasizing economic cycles or industry analysis, a bottom-up analysis focuses on company-specific circumstances, such as management quality and business prospects.
answerFeedback.e548a2a3-5abb-479c-a550-e7c01b13f611: Incorrect because a top-down analysis begins with consideration of macroeconomic conditions. Bottom-up analysis focuses on company specifics. Rather than emphasizing economic cycles or industry analysis, a bottom-up analysis focuses on company-specific circumstances, such as management quality and business prospects.
answerFeedback.e650ac27-9ea8-4f16-91d5-dbd907e3dd62: Correct because a top-down analysis begins with consideration of macroeconomic conditions. Based on the current and forecasted economic environment, analysts evaluate markets and industries with the purpose of investing in those that are expected to perform well. Finally, specific companies within these industries are considered for investment.

choices.itemBody: C. the expected growth of a company's competitors.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Chua-01
entry.itemBody: Which of the following best describes a characteristic of defined contribution pension plans?

answerFeedback.0c45ef83-b11d-48b8-94a0-c2bafac02304: Incorrect because this applies for defined benefit (DB) plans, as generally, employers are responsible for the contributions made to a DB plan and bear the risk associated with adequately funding the benefits offered to employees.
answerFeedback.b7146daf-da21-4381-adfe-3813bad1e7e9: Correct because the key to a defined contribution (DC) plan is that the employee accepts the investment and inflation risk and is responsible for ensuring that there are enough assets in the plan to meet their needs upon retirement.
answerFeedback.be130af2-69fb-4ae1-ac16-384f7b06f7ca: Incorrect because defined contribution (DC) plans typically have lower costs/risk to the company.

choices.itemBody: A. The employee accepts the investment and inflation risk.
B. The employer is responsible for adequately funding the plan.
C. Defined contribution plans typically have a higher cost to the company than defined benefit plans.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Y.Zhang-02
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements about different types of investors is most accurate?

answerFeedback.5890c012-3ae7-47aa-badd-3e9b6345aa39: Incorrect because an insurance company’s general account is typically invested conservatively in a diverse allocation of fixed-income securities, while an insurer’s surplus account typically targets a higher return than the general account and thus often invests in less-conservative asset classes.
answerFeedback.dc37f020-5516-474d-aae7-e9056e9885e5: Correct because liquidity is a paramount concern for banks that stand ready to meet depositor requests for withdrawals.
answerFeedback.f01bb7a7-b4bc-4977-b32e-5431de3833dc: Incorrect because most foundations and endowments are established with the intent of having perpetual lives. The large allocation to alternative investments primarily reflects the typically long time horizon of endowments and foundations.

choices.itemBody: A. For banks, the liquidity of their investments is a paramount concern.
B. For endowments, investment horizons are short due to their short-term spending needs.
C. For insurance companies, the risk tolerance of their general and surplus accounts is typically the same.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Ermogenous-01
entry.itemBody: Relative to passive market-cap-weighted strategies, smart beta strategies typically have:

answerFeedback.7e40dafc-8eae-4a13-a75a-8e2bd02ff41a: Incorrect because typically, smart beta strategies feature somewhat higher management fees and higher (not lower) portfolio turnover relative to passive market-cap weighted strategies.
answerFeedback.8acf6880-09d6-441a-8898-dc75892b2ef4: Correct because typically, smart beta strategies feature somewhat higher management fees and higher portfolio turnover relative to passive market-cap weighted strategies.
answerFeedback.8daea6ca-dfcb-44d1-b640-70b0826ae0f6: Incorrect because typically, smart beta strategies feature somewhat higher (not lower) management fees and higher portfolio turnover relative to passive market-cap weighted strategies.

choices.itemBody: A. lower management fees and higher portfolio turnover.
B. higher management fees and lower portfolio turnover.
C. higher management fees and higher portfolio turnover.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-PM-Niininen-02
entry.itemBody: Exchange-traded funds (ETFs):

answerFeedback.268ca424-7169-4b40-b4f1-c0215e20298b: Incorrect because ETFs can be transacted (and are priced) intraday.
answerFeedback.32b3e0ff-a80c-4e77-92fb-259e60c013f1: Incorrect because exchange-traded funds (ETFs) are generally structured as open-end funds.
answerFeedback.ac8e087f-f790-4322-b753-d0f63e0d6abe: Correct because dividends on ETFs are paid out to the shareholders whereas mutual funds usually reinvest the dividends.

choices.itemBody: A. are priced once a trading day.
B. usually pay out dividends to shareholders.
C. are generally structured as closed-end funds.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-08953
entry.itemBody: Sovereign wealth funds are best described as investment funds:

answerFeedback.1a03ce40-b198-4061-9c9b-170fba0a5dc6: Incorrect because sovereign wealth funds (SWFs) are government-owned investment funds or entities that invest in financial or real assets. In order to meet their long-term return objectives, SWFs invest in a wide range of real and financial assets or in alternative investments. The name "sovereign" wealth funds refers to the funds' ownership rather than their permitted investments.
answerFeedback.8068cd63-2752-477f-8c78-6cbe3467aeb4: Incorrect because sovereign wealth funds (SWFs) are government-owned investment funds. Closed-end funds are mutual funds in which no new investment money is accepted into the fund. New investors invest by buying existing shares, and investors in the fund liquidate by selling their shares to other investors. A mutual fund is a comingled investment pool in which investors in the fund each have a pro-rata claim on the income and value of the fund. SWFs do not pool investment money from individual investors and institutions, and they are not traded.
answerFeedback.ecafba49-4ae3-403f-9425-1a8cfd81db79: Correct because sovereign wealth funds (SWFs) are government-owned investment funds.

choices.itemBody: C. restricted from investing in foreign securities.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-07930
entry.itemBody: Which of the following funds is most likely to trade at a price furthest from its net asset value?

answerFeedback.08279c70-cb08-4422-bc05-803008859209: Incorrect because in an open-end mutual fund new shares are created and sold at the current net asset value per share.
answerFeedback.3ec77354-fc35-45f5-a649-ae561182039b: Correct because in a closed-end mutual fund the number of outstanding shares does not change. One consequence of this fixed share base is that, unlike open-end funds in which new shares are created and sold at the current net asset value per share, closed-end funds can sell for a premium or discount to net asset value depending on the demand for the shares.
answerFeedback.8df9b4d1-8145-426d-80c0-1117159b728d: Incorrect because in practice, the market price of the ETF is likely to be close to the net asset value of the underlying investments.

entry.title: CFA0158-Q1

feedback.neutral: A is correct. Combining assets into a portfolio should reduce the portfolio’s volatility. Specifically, “individuals and institutions should hold portfolios to reduce risk.” As illustrated in the reading, however, risk reduction may not be as great during a period of dramatic economic change.

entry.itemBody: Investors should use a portfolio approach to:

entry.title: CFA0158-Q2

feedback.neutral: A is correct. Combining assets into a portfolio should reduce the portfolio’s volatility. The portfolio approach does not necessarily provide downside protection or guarantee that the portfolio always will avoid losses.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following is the best reason for an investor to be concerned with the composition of a portfolio?

entry.title: CFA0158-Q3

feedback.neutral: B is correct. As illustrated in the reading, portfolios reduce risk more than they increase returns.

entry.itemBody: With respect to the formation of portfolios, which of the following statements is most accurate?

choices.itemBody: A. Portfolios affect risk less than returns.
B. Portfolios affect risk more than returns.
C. Portfolios affect risk and returns equally.

entry.title: CFA0158-Q8

feedback.neutral: C is correct. The client’s objectives and constraints are established in the investment policy statement and are used to determine the client’s target asset allocation, which occurs in the execution step of the portfolio management process.

entry.itemBody: With respect to the portfolio management process, the asset allocation is determined in the:

entry.title: CFA0158-Q9

feedback.neutral: A is correct. Securities are analyzed in the execution step. In the planning step, a client’s objectives and constraints are used to develop the investment policy statement.

entry.itemBody: The planning step of the portfolio management process is least likely to include an assessment of the client’s

entry.title: CFA0158-Q10

feedback.neutral: B is correct. Portfolio monitoring and rebalancing occurs in the feedback step of the portfolio management process.

entry.itemBody: With respect to the portfolio management process, the rebalancing of a portfolio’s composition is most likely to occur in the:

entry.title: CFA0158-Q11

feedback.neutral: C is correct. Portfolio 3 has the same equity exposure as Portfolio 1 and has a higher exposure to alternative assets, which have greater volatility (as discussed in the section of the reading comparing the endowments from Yale University and the University of Virginia).

entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information for the asset allocations of three portfolios:

Portfolio Fixed Income (%) Equity (%) Alternative Assets (%)
1 25 60 15
2 60 25 15
3 15 60 25

Which of the portfolios is most likely appropriate for a client who has a high degree of risk tolerance?

entry.title: CFA0158-Q4

feedback.neutral: A is correct. The excess reserves invested by banks need to be relatively liquid. Although investment companies and non-life insurance companies have high liquidity needs, the liquidity need for banks is on average the greatest.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following institutions will on average have the greatest need for liquidity?

entry.title: CFA0158-Q5

feedback.neutral: B is correct. Most foundations and endowments are established with the intent of having perpetual lives. Although defined benefit plans and life insurance companies have portfolios with a long time horizon, they are not perpetual.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following institutional investors will most likely have the longest time horizon?

entry.title: CFA0158-Q6

feedback.neutral: A is correct. Income is necessary to meet the cash flow obligation to retirees. Although defined benefit plans have a need for income, the need for liquidity typically is quite low. A retiree may need life insurance; however, a defined benefit plan does not need insurance.

entry.itemBody: A defined benefit plan with a large number of retirees is likely to have a high need for:

entry.title: CFA0158-Q7

feedback.neutral: B is correct. Investment companies manage investments in mutual funds. Although endowments and insurance companies may own mutual funds, they do not issue or redeem shares of mutual funds.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following institutional investors is most likely to manage investments in mutual funds?

entry.title: CFA0158-Q12

feedback.neutral: B is correct. Open-end funds trade at their net asset value per share, whereas closed-end funds and exchange traded funds can trade at a premium or a discount.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following investment products is most likely to trade at their net asset value per share?

entry.title: CFA0158-Q13

feedback.neutral: A is correct. Exchange traded funds do not have capital gain distributions. If an investor sells shares of an ETF (or open-end mutual fund or closed-end mutual fund), the investor may have a capital gain or loss on the shares sold; however, the gain (or loss) from the sale is not a distribution.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following financial products is least likely to have a capital gain distribution?

entry.title: CFA0158-Q14

feedback.neutral: A is correct. Hedge funds are currently exempt from the reporting requirements of a typical public investment company.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following forms of pooled investments is subject to the least amount of regulation?

entry.title: CFA0158-Q15

feedback.neutral: B is correct. Buyout funds or private equity firms make only a few large investments in private companies with the intent of selling the restructured companies in three to five years. Venture capital funds also have a short time horizon; however, these funds consist of many small investments in companies with the expectation that only a few will have a large payoff (and that most will fail).

entry.itemBody: Which of the following pooled investments is most likely characterized by a few large investments?

entry.title: ITEM_20170606001
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is least likely a part of the execution step of the portfolio management process?

answerFeedback.0f916d07-4b3c-41a9-8337-c6c2b525f268: Incorrect. Portfolio construction is a part of the execution step of the portfolio management process.
answerFeedback.6d337b0f-fe04-4353-9cf5-388780988797: Incorrect. Security analysis is a part of the execution step of the portfolio management process.
answerFeedback.f739abab-1b07-4af4-9c72-cd2cafabecb7: Correct. Performance measurement is a part of the feedback step of the portfolio management process. The execution step includes asset allocation, security analysis, and portfolio construction.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606009
entry.itemBody: Which of the following institutional investors is most likely to have a low tolerance for investment risk and relatively high liquidity needs?

answerFeedback.750f6bda-7585-4cd4-9676-c8deded7f1e5: Incorrect. Defined-benefit pension plans tend to have quite high risk tolerances and quite low liquidity needs.
answerFeedback.a548c51a-33a1-4c22-b000-0aed5d5a2d4e: Correct. Insurance companies need to be relatively conservative and liquid, given the necessity of paying claims when due.
answerFeedback.ea47484e-b42e-4fcd-b9e9-46cc04aa2117: Incorrect. Endowments/foundations typically have high risk tolerances and quite low liquidity needs.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606014
entry.itemBody: The execution step of the portfolio management process includes:

answerFeedback.05a84f1d-101d-41d0-a4d7-593d5bec5428: Incorrect. Preparation of the investment policy statement occurs in the planning step.
answerFeedback.819085a7-9954-4b26-95c4-852985919c56: Incorrect. Portfolio monitoring occurs in the feedback step.
answerFeedback.b85928a8-6bf7-449d-a7ef-b0bb4578842c: Correct. Asset allocation occurs in the execution step.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606043
entry.itemBody: Which of the following types of institutions is most likely to have a long investment time horizon and a higher level of risk tolerance?

answerFeedback.087c3827-9768-49fe-b6e2-fe3511444fdb: Incorrect. Banks have a short investment time horizon and a low level of risk tolerance.
answerFeedback.53f407d2-7491-4f4d-b082-a510f61af459: Incorrect. Insurance companies have a short investment time horizon and a low level of risk tolerance.
answerFeedback.b3283683-fb33-43b8-9064-bb4e5feb9a06: Correct. Endowments have a long investment time horizon and a high level of risk tolerance.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606048
entry.itemBody: With respect to the portfolio management process, asset allocation decisions are most likely made in the:

answerFeedback.16700ecd-10ab-48c3-927f-1b62a301d8a9: Correct. Asset allocation decisions are made in the execution step.
answerFeedback.58b47503-8c37-4de0-a166-bc95a3f1fdf9: Incorrect. Asset allocation decisions are not made in the feedback step.
answerFeedback.737cbb96-c7f5-4ad5-8420-4ecc2512e3f4: Incorrect. Asset allocation decisions are not made in the planning step.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606049
entry.itemBody: A key difference between a wrap account and a mutual fund is that wrap accounts:

answerFeedback.25a19df5-166d-45ba-9cd3-20c1dadfb7c5: Correct. The key difference between a wrap account and a mutual fund is that in a wrap account, the assets are owned directly by the individual.
answerFeedback.6753f95c-8a8a-4c26-9552-80be407819e0: Incorrect. Wrap accounts can be tailored to the tax needs of a client.
answerFeedback.7c43a2b2-9e83-4e2d-a3d7-d347c97cce63: Incorrect. Wrap accounts have higher required minimum investments.

choices.itemBody: A. have assets that are owned directly by the individual.
B. cannot be tailored to the tax needs of a client.
C. have a lower required minimum investment.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606063
entry.itemBody: Which of the following types of investment clients most likely have the lowest liquidity needs?

answerFeedback.1fffea19-9ff8-4f75-af2e-ae1c71e638d7: Incorrect. Insurance companies have liquidity needs to meet claims.
answerFeedback.f860429f-3870-4731-a807-5c43eac07e00: Correct. A typical investment objective of an endowment or a foundation is to maintain the real capital value of the fund while generating income to fund the objectives of the institution. Liquidity needs are typically rather low.
answerFeedback.fe450d53-09cd-40a8-9261-228012143a7d: Incorrect. Banks have high liquidity needs to meet repayment of deposits.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606064
entry.itemBody: Security analysis is most likely a part of which step in the portfolio management process?

answerFeedback.20e63fc1-ada3-4bbe-b734-c83b09768ba8: Incorrect. Under the planning step, there are two parts: understating the client’s needs and preparation of an investment policy statement.
answerFeedback.2f27249c-7008-4a9d-808c-3ac078feb4cc: Correct. The execution step of the portfolio management process has three parts: asset allocation, security analysis, and portfolio construction.
answerFeedback.e34d73b3-e066-4849-b7c8-7b63c46ee6a0: Incorrect. Under the feedback step, there are two parts: portfolio monitoring and rebalancing and performance measurement and reporting.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606070
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is most likely a feature of a defined-contribution pension plan? The

answerFeedback.1ca07b8c-bb21-4786-8f41-1b8f63344dd4: Incorrect. This is a feature of a defined-benefit plan.
answerFeedback.3d7f71d1-eead-41df-a36a-0a19188253f5: Incorrect. This is a feature of a defined-benefit plan.
answerFeedback.f4a6c575-06a7-451b-a685-e4bd83a588df: Correct. In a defined-contribution pension plan, the employee accepts the investment risk and is responsible for ensuring that the plan contains enough funds to meet retirement needs.

choices.itemBody: B. employer provides a specified retirement benefit.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606087
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is least likely true for a separately managed account (SMA) compared with a mutual fund?

answerFeedback.216bb538-928a-43a4-b0ca-6f5de90cb022: Incorrect. SMA assets are directly owned by the individual. The investor has control over which assets are bought and sold as well as the timing of the transactions.
answerFeedback.8b7fac8b-24a3-4f7e-9399-f1619759323b: Correct. The minimum investment required to open a separately managed account is usually much higher than that to open a mutual fund.
answerFeedback.d87e5ce1-6ea4-43eb-9c87-579b984ed12a: Incorrect. SMA transactions can be tailored to the specific tax needs of the investor.

choices.itemBody: A. Assets are directly owned by the individual.
B. The minimum investment required to open a SMA is lower than that of a mutual fund.
C. Transactions can be tailored to the specific tax needs of the investor.

entry.title: ITEM_20170606093
entry.itemBody: ABC Fund invests in Singapore’s government debt with maturities up to three months. It is most likely classified as a:

answerFeedback.6587ae95-6dbd-4cde-b25d-df2c9d5be4c0: Incorrect. A fixed-income arbitrage fund attempts to profit from arbitrage opportunities in interest rate securities.
answerFeedback.8b6be645-745a-427a-ac41-fd1ad2f9ebf7: Incorrect. Bond mutual funds hold bonds with maturities as short as one year and as long as 30 years.
answerFeedback.dd93a8ea-d546-4caf-b23d-0d1d03f713ff: Correct. Money market funds invest in short-term corporate or government debt. The difference between a bond mutual fund and a money market fund is the maturity of the underlying assets. In a money market fund, the maturity is as short as overnight and rarely longer than 90 days.
